text:
So the tricky part with adding it as <@U02HBK93SPQ> and <@UMZFZHVUJ> are recommending is that it’s really not so scaleable. From a UX experience on the content editing side youre now talking about including some kind of blockquote selector on every module that includes an RTE. Not to mention a module that may have mulitiple RTE’s. I don’t think that including it as a field is the way to go.

I can imagine <@UBT0AHWLD>’s case being something similar to having multiple blockquote styles. And Something like that should really be set in the RTE itself. It really is no different than a heading. There is already a blockquote style there anyway. It would def be pretty great if a developer could add some custom tabs or tags to the RTE itself.

<@UQWGKUEN7> it’d be ideal solution
I guess, right now, there is no such option, right?

Correct — I think Andreas is getting at is that for the HS theme challenge it’s technically against the rules to add classnames inside of an RTE for a submission to be valid. And if a blog post has multiple styles of blockquote then it would appear that there is no way of displaying those different blockquote styles as an example.

<@UQWGKUEN7> yes that is correct i think it would be awesome to be able to have those custom styles , be it to style and Quote, an Info, a Warning, a Tip a Linklist. For those interested, i think this blogpost shows some of the ideas that would be really cool to have in a HubSpot RTE: <https://www.bayer.com/en/sustainability/targets>
I wish we could add modules to blog posts. It’d make life much easier in terms of customization

It would be nice! But man — what a headache for standardizing content and making it easy to grab, on the HubSpot Dev side at least. I can totally understand their reservation on it. But it would be super cool if they figured out a way to make it work and still easy to import/export blogs and pull their data on listing pages etc.

we might not need that. If we would be allowed to split the
```   {{ content.post_body }} ```
in  multiple parts we could then put our modules etc in between
